docs.snippet: After years of mocking his Republican predecessor, is President Trump now following in W.’s pre-emptive footsteps?
If President Trump wanted a national security adviser who would match his confrontational approach to the world, then Mr. Bolton fits the bill.

headline.print_headline: Hawk Among Hawks Eager to Confront Foreign Adversaries
headline.main: John Bolton, an Undiplomatic Voice for American Might

docs.snippet: Government and industry officials around the world warned of an escalating trade war, but President Trump doubled down on his vow, tweeting, “Trade wars are good, and easy to win.”

headline.main: E.U. Leader Threatens to Retaliate With Tariffs on Bourbon and Bluejeans

docs.snippet: Investors spent the last three years piling into the shares of the biggest tech companies. Now the intellectual underpinnings of the tech rally are being seriously tested.

headline.main: More Than Just a Sell-Off in Tech?: DealBook Briefing

docs.snippet: Companies and law enforcement agencies in California carefully tread between federal laws devised to catch undocumented workers and new state laws meant to protect them.

headline.print_headline: Feud Over ICE Squeezes Employers in California
headline.main: ‘I Am a Pawn’: Trump’s Immigration Fight With California Squeezes Those Caught in the Middle

docs.snippet: An agreement expanding the American military’s relationship with Ghana struck a nerve on a continent where the presence of United States soldiers is receiving more scrutiny.

headline.print_headline: Deal Expanding U.S. Military’s Role in Ghana Spurs Protests
headline.main: Deal With U.S. Military Sets Off Protests in Ghana

docs.snippet: President Moon Jae-in will send two top aides to North Korea on Monday in an attempt to defuse tensions on the peninsula.

headline.print_headline: South Korea Names 2 Envoys to Meet With Kim Jong-un
headline.main: South Korea Names 2 Envoys to Meet With Kim Jong-un

docs.snippet: The most ignorant man in America knows that Donald Trump is president — but that’s about it. Living a liberal fantasy is complicated.

headline.print_headline: The Man Who Knew Too Little
headline.main: The Man Who Knew Too Little

docs.snippet: Readers discuss the firing of Rex Tillerson (via a tweet) and the nomination of a woman who oversaw torture to lead the C.I.A.

headline.print_headline: Changes in the Cabinet and the C.I.A.
headline.main: Changes in the Cabinet and the C.I.A.

docs.snippet: Tensions over criminal justice policy have pitted the president’s son-in-law against his attorney general, and resulted in a seesawing approach to prisons.

headline.print_headline: Kushner Spars With Sessions, In Whiplash on Prisons Policy
headline.main: Sessions and Kushner Square Off, and Prisoners Hang in the Balance
